column4: 1 a pron. stem: asyá gen. sg. m., asmai dat., asmin loc.
4 aṁśú m. 'filament esp. of soma-plant' RV., 'thread, minute particle, ray'.
7 áṁsiya-, áṁsya 'belonging to the shoulder' RV., '*made of or shaped like the shoulder-blade'. [áṁsa-]
9a †akarmán- 'not working, not performing good works' RV. [kárman-¹: √kr̥]
16 akkā 'mother' Kāś. [← Drav. Burrow, BSOAS 12, 365: Tam. akkai 'elder sister']
17 *akkha 'sacking, bag, net'. [Perh. conn. Sk. ákṣi-, if Pa. akkhika- n. 'mesh of a net' < '*having eyes']
19 akrōdha m. 'freedom from anger', cf. akrōdhamáya- 'free from anger' ŚBr. [krṓdha-]
21 ákṣa¹ m. 'axle' RV., 'collar-bone' ŚBr., 'temporal bone' Yājñ., akṣaka- m.n. 'collar-bone' Suśr. [Perh. conn. ákṣu-]
22 akṣá² m. 'a die for gambling' RV., 'the tree Elaeocarpus ganitrus' Suśr., 'its seed (of which rosaries were made and which were used for dice)'.
23 akṣa-³ n. 'eye' lex. [-akṣá- in cmpd. for ákṣi- Pāṇ.]
24 akṣa-⁴ n. 'blue vitriol' lex. [Cf. Av. axšaēna- 'dark-coloured', Yid. axšin 'blue' Horn NPE 109, Morgenstierne IIFL ii 195, W. S. Allen The Classical Quarterly xli 88 note 1]
28 ákṣata 'unhurt' RV., 'not crushed' ĀśvGr̥., m. pl. 'uncrushed barley' Kālid. [kṣatá-¹]
31 akṣadhur f. 'pin or pole of axle'. [ákṣa-¹, dhúr-]
35 akṣamālā f. 'string of rosary beads' lex., cf. akṣamālin- m. 'name of Śiva' MBh. [akṣá-², mālā-]
37 akṣayatr̥tīyā f. 'festival on third day of bright half of Vaiśākha (which secured permanence for actions then initiated)'. [akṣaya-, tr̥tīˊya-¹]
38 akṣára 'indestructible', n. 'word, syllable' RV., 'letter of the devanāgarī syllabary'
39 akṣavāṭa-, -pāṭa- m. 'wrestling ground' lex. [lit. 'fence of poles' or 'dicing ground'
44 akṣibhruva n. 'the eyes and the brows' Pāṇ. [ákṣi-, bhrūˊ-]
45 *akṣirujā f. 'eye-disease'. [Cf. akṣiruj- f. VarBr̥S., Pa. akkhirōga- m.: ákṣi-, rujā-]
46 ákṣu m. perh. 'bamboo-pole' AV. (T. Chowdhury JBORS xvii 26.) [Cf. ákṣa-¹, ikṣú-]
48 akṣōṭa m. 'walnut (or pistacio nut ?)' Kālid., 'Aleurites triloba, Croton moluccanum' Suśr., 'a mountain-tree pīlú-¹', lex.; akṣōḍa-, °aka-, ākṣōḍa-, ākhōṭa- lex
48b †akhila- 'complete, whole' Kāv. [Closer to khila-², *khilla- in the (generalized?) sense 'defect' than to khilá-¹, khilyá- in the special sense 'uncultivated, fallow land'
49 agaru m.n. 'fragrant Aloe-tree and wood, Aquilaria agallocha' lex., aguru- R. [← Drav. Mayrhofer EWA i 17 with lit.]
50 agásti m. 'the tree Agasti grandiflorum' Suśr. [← Drav. Burrow BSOAS 12, 365; Agásti- m. 'nom. prop.' perh. from this, Mayrhofer EWA I 17]
52 agāra n. 'house' ĀśvGr̥., āgāra- Mn. [Prob. ← Drav., Mayrhofer EWA i 17 with lit.]
53 *agāhya 'unfathomable'. [Cf. durgāhya- Suśr. (to be separated fr. agādha- 'deep' R. < '*having no ford'): √gāh]
56 agni² m. 'name of various plants, Plumbago zeylanica (Suśr.), Semecarpus anacardium, Citrus acida (lex.)'. [Same as agní-¹ ?]
57 agnika '*fiery', m. 'the plant Semecarpus anacardium; a partic. scarlet insect' lex., cf. āgnika- 'belonging to the preparation of the sacred fire' KātyŚr. [agní-¹]
58 agnikārya m. 'kindling the sacred fire with butter' Mn., °rikā- f. lex. [agní-¹, kāryà-]
59 agnidāha m. 'a fiery glow (in the sky)' Hariv. [Cf. agnídagdha- 'burnt with fire' RV.: agní-¹, dāha-]
60 agnidhā́na n. 'receptacle for the sacred fire' RV. [agní-¹, dhā́na-]
61 agnimantha 'producing fire by friction', m. 'the tree Premna spinosa' Suśr. [agní-¹, mantha-]
65 agniṣṭhá m. 'fire-pan' ĀpŚr., °ṭhā́- f. 'that corner of the Yūpa towards the fire' ŚBr., °ṭhikā- f. 'fire-pan'. [agní-¹, stha-]
67 agnyagārá m. 'a house for keeping the sacred fire' ŚBr., agnyā° KātyŚr., *agniyā̆°. [agní-¹, agāra-]
76 agrapūjā f. 'highest act of reverence' R. [ágra-, pūjā-]
88 agrahāyaṇa m. 'the month November-December (= mārgaśīrṣa-)' lex. [Cf. āgrahāyaṇī- f. 'the full moonday in that month' Pāṇ.: ágra-, hāyaná-]
98 *agryapaṇa 'chief price or payment in first-fruits.' [agryá-, paṇa-]
100 aṅká m. 'hook' RV., 'hip where children are carried' Br̥ĀrUp., 'curved line, mark, sign' R. [√añc]
102 aṅkana adj. 'marking' Nir., n. 'branding' Mit. com. [aṅkáyati, aṅká-: √añc]

107 *aṅku 'hook' in ankuṭa-, aṅkurá-, aṅkuśá-. [Cf. Av. anku- in cmpd. 'hook': √añc]

108 aṅkuṭa m. 'instrument for moving the bolt or bar of a door' lex. [*aṅku-: √añc]
113 aṅkōṭa-, aṅkōṭha m. 'the small tree Alangium hexapetalum' lex. 2. aṅkōla-, °aka-. 3. aṅkōlla-. [EWA i 20 with lit.]
115 *aṅgakr̥ṣṭi f. 'stretching the body'. [áṅga-¹, kr̥ṣṭí- or poss. *vikr̥ṣṭi-]
116 aṅgajāta 'produced from the body' MW without ref. [áṅga-¹, jātá-]
117 aṅgada n. 'bracelet on upper arm' R. [← Muṇḍa Kuiper PMWS 124]
118 aṅgana n. 'act of walking' lex., 'courtyard' R., °aṇa- n. Kālid. [√aṅg]
119 aṅganā́ f. 'woman' R., 'beautiful woman' lex. [← Austro-as. Mayrhofer EWA i 20 with lit.]
121 aṅgarāga m. 'application of ointment, cosmetic' R. [áṅga-¹, rā́ga-¹]
125 áṅgāra m. n. 'glowing charcoal' RV., °aka- lex. 2. *iṅgāra-, iṅgāla- m. Vāsav. com.
126 aṅgāraka '*red like embers', m. 'charcoal; name of various plants' (aṅgārikā- f. 'stalk of sugar-cane, flower of Butea frondosa'). 2. m. 'the planet Mars'. [áṅgāra-]
131 aṅgāryā́-, *aṅgāriyā-, f. 'heap of embers'. [Cf. aṅgā- rīya- 'fit for making charcoal', aṅgārikā- f., angāritā- f. 'portable fireplace' lex.: áṅgāra-]
132 aṅgikā f. 'woman's bodice'. [áṅga-¹: perh. replacing *aṅgiya-, áṅgya- 'belonging to the limbs' RV.]
135 aṅgúli f. 'finger, toe' VS., ŚBr., aṅgúri- f. AV., svaṅgurí- RV. 2. *aṅgūḍi- [2 < *aṅguẓ-ḍi- with *aṅguṣ- in aṅguṣ-ṭhá-, cf. H. Frisk Suffixales -i>th- im Indogermanischen 17.]
137 aṅguṣṭhá-, °gú° m. 'thumb' ĀśvGr̥., 'big toe' KātyŚr. [aṅgu-ṣ-ṭhá-, cf. *aṅgu-ẓ-ḍi- and aṅgú-li-]

139 aṅgōñcha m., aṅgōñchana- n. 'towel' lex. [Poss. áṅga-¹, uñchá- m. 'gleaning esp. of single grains' (for meaning 'sweeping together, wiping' cf. development of meaning under úñchati and prōñchati). But N. Bi. H. point to MIA. *aṅga-u{ñ}cha- (with aṅgōñcha- as late Sanskritization), poss. a MIA. form with *-vuñcha- anal. replacing puñcha- < prōñcha- (as suggested by Platts UD s.v. and P. Tedesco JAOS 77. 195). In either case loss of second nasal, through dissimilation, was early (contrast úñchati, prōñchati). In any case Bloch LM 286 wrongly < aṅgavastra.]
142 accha¹ 'clear, transparent' Suśr. [Poss. 'shadowless' cf. acchāyá- RV. Neither *r̥kṣa- (Mayrhofer EWA i 22) nor ā̆rca- (P. Tedesco JAOS 77, 197) are phonet. satisfactory.]
144 acchidat 3 sg. aor. ind. 'has cut' Pāṇ., subj. chidat{i} ŚBr. [√chid]
145 ajá m. 'goat', ajā́- f. RV., ajakā-, -ikā- f. 'small or young goat' Pāṇ.
147 ajakarṇa m. 'a goat's ear' KātyŚr., 'the tree Terminalia alata tomentosa' Suśr., °aka- m. 'the tree Shorea robusta' lex. [ajá-, kárṇa-]
152 ajamōda m.,-ā-, -ikā- f. 'carroway, parsley, Ligusticum ajwaen' Suśr. [Pop. etym. ajá-, mōda-: cf. ajāji-, yavānī-]
153 ajarā f. 'Aloe perfoliata, Argyreia speciosa' lex. [Cf. ajāgara- m. 'Eclipta or Verbesina prostrata']
154 *ajavāṭa m. 'goat-pen'. [ajá-, vāṭa-¹: with EH. -r- < -ṭ- rather than < -vāra-]
155 ajavīthi f. 'path of the constellation Aries' Yājñ. [ajá-, vīthi-]
156 ajājĭ̄ f. 'Cuminum cyminum, Ficus oppositifolia, Nigella indica' Suśr. [Cf. ajamōda-, yavānī-]
158 ajína n. 'skin of esp. the black antelope used by ascetics' AV. [ajá-]
168 añcala m.n. 'border or end of a garment' Pañcat. [√añc]
171 añjalí m. 'the hollowed hands placed together' ŚBr.
175 aṭani-, -ī- f. 'notched extremity of a bow'. [i.e. supporter of the string
176 aṭaruṣa m. 'the shrub Justicia adhatoda' lex., °rūṣaka- m. Suśr.
178 *aṭṭ¹ 'contain, be contained, fit into'. [Poss. < ā́rta-¹ '*brought', cf. ā́-r̥ṇvati 'brings, reaches, obtains' RV., despite ă of P.: √r̥]
180 aṭṭa² 'high', m. 'tower, watchtower' Kālid., aṭṭaka- m. 'tower' lex. [Non-aryan Mayrhofer EWA i 25]
183 *aṭṭakkalā 'guess'. [Poss. contains kalā́-: for first part cf. L. aṭṭā-saṭṭā m. 'rough guess' and *aṇṭ-]
190 aḍḍana n. 'shield' lex. [Mayrhofer EWA i 25 connects with aṭṭa-²; perh. rather to *aḍḍ- 'obstruct']
191 *aḍḍi 'heel'. 2. *aḍi-. 3. *ēḍḍi-. 4. *ēḍi-. [J. Bloch BSOS v 738 ← Drav., cf. Tam. Kan. aḍi, Tel. aḍugu 'foot, footstep']
192 áṇu¹ m. 'the grain-plant Panicum miliaceum' VS. [Same as aṇu-² ?]
193 aṇu² 'fine, minute' Br̥ĀrUp.; áṇvī- f. 'epithet of the fingers preparing Soma-juice' RV., aṇú 'minutely' ŚBr.
210 *atiyañcati 'pulls across'. [For áti with a verb 'to pull' cf. atikarṣati 'pulls (ploughshare)' Kauś.: √añc]
213 *ativr̥tta 'passed beyond'. [Cf. ativivartayati 'separates too far' RV.Prāt., ativr̥tti- f. 'excess' Pāṇ.Kāś.: √vr̥t¹]
217 atiṣṭhā́ '*jutting out' (f. 'superiority' ŚBr.) [átitiṣṭhati 'juts out or over' TBr.: √sthā]
218 *atiṣphāyatē 'swells, is complete, arrives'. [For semantic development cf. sphā́yatē, *niṣphāyatē, pūryatē, prábhūta-: √sphāy]
219 atihr̥ta 'added to'. [átiharati 'stands out above' ŚBr., Pa. atiharati 'brings over': √hr̥]
222 attā f. 'mother, mother's sister, elder sister' lex., atti{kā}-, anti{kā}- f. 'elder sister' lex. 2. *addā-. [← Drav. Tam. attai 'aunt, mother-in-law' T. Burrow BSOAS xii 366. Cf. *atta-²]
226a †*atyuṣati 'burns'. 2. †*atyōṣati. 3. †*atyuṣyatē 'is burnt'. [Semant. rather than with Him.I 52 < cūṣati: cf. uṣṇánt- RV., ōṣati Pāṇ., †*atyuṣṇa-, átidahati ŚBr., and †*adhyuṣyatē: √vas³]
235 *adinna 'not given'. [Cf. ádatta- 'not having given' AV., 'not given' Mn.: *dinna-]
237 adr̥śya 'not to be seen' TUp. [Cf. adrēśya- s.v. *dēkṣati: dr̥śya-, √dr̥ś]
241 admasád m. 'guest at a meal', perh. 'fly' at RV. i 124, 4 K. F. Geldner Vedische Studien ii 179, but disputed by H. Oldenberg Vedaforschung 90. [ádman-, √sad-]
244 *adyāhnaḥ 'this very day'. [Cf. idā́nīm and idā́ áhnaḥ RV.: adyá, áhar-]
245a †*adhaōṣṭha- 'lower lip' (cf. adharauṣṭha- m. n. 'upper and lower lip, the lips' Kālid.) suggested by K. R. Norman (quoted by J. D. Smith Vīsaḷa 335). [adháḥ, ṓṣṭha-]
256 *ádhiyardha-, ádhyardha- 'one and a half' ŚBr., ádhyardhaka- 'worth one and a half' Pāṇ. [ardhá-²]
258 *ádhiyēti 'goes to'. [Cf. ádhyēti 'turns the mind to' RV. and ádhigacchati 'approaches': √i²]
260 *adhivāsayati 'causes to remain', adhivāsa- m. 'sitting obstinately before a debtor's door'. [adhivasati 'dwells' Mn., Pk. ahivasaï 'stays': √vas²]
270a †ádhr̥ta- 'uncontrolled, restless' TS. (cf. ádhr̥ti- f. 'restlessness' ŚBr., 'discomfort' Suśr., Pk. addhii-, adhii- f. 'inconstancy'). [√dhr̥]
278 adhyāpaka m. 'teacher' Mn., -adhyāya- (at end of cmpd.) 'reader' Pāṇ. [√i²]
279 adhyāyá m. 'reading' Pāṇ., 'time given to reading' Mn. [√i²]
288 ánanna '*without food' (n. 'rice undeserving of its name' ŚBr.) [ánna-]
289 ánapēkṣa 'careless' R., ánapēkṣam adv. ŚBr. [apēkṣā- f. 'consideration, expectation' Mn., Pa. apekkhā- f., Pk. avekkhā-, avik° f.: √īkṣ]
291 anartha 'useless, unfortunate' Mn., m. 'loss, misfortune' R., anarthyá- 'useless' ŚBr. [ártha-]
308 ánīka n. 'face, front, point, edge, row' RV., 'army' Bhag.
318 *anutr̥tīyam 'on the third day'. [For formation cf. anurātram 'in the night' AitBr.: see also s.v. tr̥tīˊya-¹]
323 anupatati 'flies past or after' ĀśvGr̥. [Cf. ánupātayati 'flies along' AV.: √pat]
334 *anulabdha pp. of ánulabhatē 'takes hold of from behind' ŚBr. [√labh]
335 *anuvara 'following the bridegroom'. [For formation cf. ánupatha- 'following the road' RV., anupati 'after the husband': vará-²]
343 anūpá m. 'pond' RV., 'watery place' Mn., 'bank of river' lex. [ap-]
346 anēnás 'sinless, blameless', anēḍa-, °ēla-, nēla- 'pure' BHSk., 'stupid' lex. [For MIA. dissimilation ṇ-ṇ to ṇ-ḍ see ajñānin: ḗnas-]
347 ánta m. 'end, border, proximity' RV., 'inside' R.; antaká- m. 'border (of a field)' ŚBr.
351 antaḥpurika m. 'harem attendant', °kā- f. 'a woman of the harem' MW. [antaḥpura-]
357 ántara¹ 'interior, near' RV., 'neighbouring' ŚBr., n. 'the inside' Mn., °rā́, °rēṇa, °rē 'in the middle'. [ántar]
358 ántara² 'different, other' ŚBr. [In some cmpds. difficult to distinguish from ántara-¹: ana-]
367 antarāla n. 'intermediate space' Pāṇ. [ext. with -la- of antarā́ ? No support in NIA. for the -āḷa- proposed by Lüders PhilInd 549]
372 antarnagara n. 'palace of a king' R. [antár, nágara-]
377 antiká 'near', n. 'nearness', °kám, °kḗ 'in the presence of' RV. [ánti 'near' RV.]
378 antēvāsín m. 'pupil who dwells near his master' ŚBr. [ánta-, vāsín-³]
382 andūˊ-, °u- f., °ū˘ka- m. 'chain for an elephant's foot' Śiś. [√and]
386 andhakāra m.n. 'darkness' R. 2. *andhĭ̄kāra- influenced by andhīkarōti 'makes blind' H. Smith BSL 101, 115. [andhá-, kāra-¹]
387 *andhatamisrikā, andhatamisra- n. 'complete darkness of the soul' VP., °tā° Mn. [Cf. andhatamasá- n. 'thick darkness' Pāṇ., Pa. andhatamō n., Pk. aṁdhatamasa- n.: andhá-, támisrā-]
395 ánna n. 'food' RV., 'cooked rice, corn in general' Mn. 2. *anda-² < *adna- with metathesis before assimilation, Morgenstierne NTS ii 242. [√ad]
408 apakarṣati 'draws away' MBh. [Cf. apakr̥ṣṭa-, Pa. apakaṭṭha- 'drawn away'; Aś. mi. apakaṭha- 'distant'; replaced by *kaḍḍh- in Pa. apakaḍḍhati, Pk. ōyaḍḍhaï 'drags': √kr̥ṣ]
409 *apakaṣa 'scraper'. [Cf. ápakaṣati 'scrapes off' AV., used in conjunction with takṣ-: √kaṣ]
412 apakta 'not cooked'. [Cf. paktí- f. 'cooking, food' RV., pá° VS. and apakva-: √pac]
423 *apatāna-, apatānaka- m. 'spasmodic contraction of body or stomach' Suśr. [√tan]
426 *apadāha 'burning'. [Cf. ápadahati 'drives away by burning' RV., 'burns up' MBh.: √dah]
429 apadhārayati '*holds away'. [In BHSk. and Pa. the meaning 'considers' was influenced by avadhārayati: √dhr̥]
433 apamāna m. 'disrespect, disgrace' R. [Cf. avamāna- m. Mn., Pa. ōmāna-, Pk. ōmāṇa-: māna-¹: √man]
434 ápara 'posterior' RV., 'different, other' ŚBr. 2. *aparīya- Morgenstierne IIFL iii 3, 187. 3. áparam RV., °rám AV. 'again, moreover'.
435 aparajá 'born later' VS. [Cf. avaraja- 'younger', m. 'younger brother' R.: ápara-, ja-]
436 apararātrá n. 'latter part of night, end of night' ŚBr. [ápara-, rātra-]
438 aparaśvas adv. 'the day after tomorrow' Gobh. [Cf. paraśvas: ápara-, śvás]
441 aparānta 'dwelling on the western border' R., m. 'the country to the west and its people' MBh. [ápara-, ánta-]
444 *aparēndra [ápara- or a-para- 'unrivalled', indrá-] Kal. rumb. warīˊn, gen. -dras 'name of a god'.
467 apaskara m. 'faeces' Vet. and avaskara- m. 'faeces', °aka- m. 'an insect originating in faeces' Pāṇ. [√kr̥̄]
468 apasphúra 'jerking'. [Cf. ánapasphura-, ᶜrant- '(of a cow) not refusing to be milked' RV.: √sphur]
471 apahara m. 'carrying off' Bhām. [Cf. apahāra- m. 'stealing' R., Pk. avahāra- m.: √hr̥]
473 apahāsa m. 'mocking laugh' R. [Cf. avahāsa- m. MBh., Pk. ōhāsa- m.: √has]
480 apāmārgá m. 'the plant Achyranthes aspera (used in washing linen)' AV. [√mr̥j]
488 apidhā́na n. 'cloth for covering, cover' RV., °nī- f. 'cover' Āp. [√dhā]

491 apūpá m. 'cake of flour' RV. 2. pūpa- m. 'a kind of cake' MBh. 3. pūpalā- f. 'a sweet cake fried with ghee or oil' lex., °lik̇ā- Car., pūpālik̇ā- Suśr. [J. Charpentier, Le Monde Oriental xxvi 112 ← Drav. Tam. appam, &c. cf. also Muṇḍa in Savara p̣upu 'cake, bread, pudding' ← Sk ? Poss. further conn. in pūra-², pauli-]
492 apūpíya-, °pyà- 'fit for cakes' Pāṇ., n. 'meal' lex., °pīˊya- Pāṇ. [apūpá-]
501 ápya 'being in water' RV., or ā́pya- 'living in water, belonging to water' Suśr. [áp-]
502 apsarás f. 'one of the female divinities connected with water' RV. [áp-]
504 ábrahman 'without Brahman' RV., abráhman- m. 'what is not B.' [bráhman-]
509 *abhāriya 'not to be borne'. [Cf. bhāryà- 'to be borne' TS.: √bhr̥]
509a †abhíkarōti, abhíkr̥ṇōti 'does on behalf of, effects' RV. AV. 2. †*abhikr̥ta-. [√kr̥]
519 abhidhyā f. 'wish, covetousness' BHSk. [Cf. abhídhyāyati 'sets one's heart on' TS.: √dhyai.]
520 *abhinābhi 'up to the navel' [For abhi- cf. abhijñú 'up to the knee' RV.: nā́bhi-]
521 abhiplavá m. ('a partic. religious ceremony' ŚBr., abhiprava- Kāṭh.) '*overflow, *flood'. [Cf. abhipluta- 'overflowed' MBh.: √plu]
523 abhimanyu m. 'nom. prop. of a son of Arjuna'. [√man]
526 *abhimlāyati 'withers'. 2. *abhimlāpayati 'causes to wither'. [Cf. mlā́yati 'withers' ŚBr., caus. mlāpáyati AV., án-abhimlāta-varṇa- 'of unfaded colour' RV.: √mlai]
527 *abhiyávaharati, abhyá° 'throws down (into water)' VS. 2. *abhiyavaharaṇa-, abhyavahá° n. 'throwing down' ŚBr. 3. *abhiyavahāra-, abhya° m. 'taking food' Mn. [√hr̥]
534 abhihāra m. 'bringing near' Pat., '*offering'. [Cf. abhíharati 'brings, offers' ŚBr., Pk. ahiharaï 'takes, raises': √hr̥]
540 abhukta 'not eaten, who has not eaten' (= abhuktavant- MBh.) MW. 2. *abhugna-. [bhuktá-: √bhuj²]

546 abhyàsyati 'throws on' ŚBr., 'concentrates on, practises' MBh., abhyasatē Mn.; abhyasana- n. 'practice' Mn. 2. *abhíyāsayati. [Cf. Pa. abhyāsa-, abbhāsa- m. 'repetition'; Pk. abbhasaï 'learns': √as²]
549 abhrá¹ n. (rarely m.) 'cloud, rainy weather' RV. 2. abhríya- 'belonging to the clouds', m.n. 'thundercloud' RV.

1012 ākula 'confused' MBh., 'filled with, crowded' R. 2. With anal. -kk-. [Connexion with √kr̥̄¹ denied by Mayrhofer EWA i 69; poss. Muṇḍa origin and farther connexions in IA. Kuiper PMWS 16. 1545 ā́hārayati 'procures' ŚBr., 'takes for oneself, enjoys, eats' MBh. [√hr̥]

'a roll (of cloth, hairs, or the like), aṇḍūpaka- n. 'circular roll of cloth used as a stand for a vessel']
1563 itkaṭa-, ikkaṭa- m. 'a kind of reed or grass' lex. 2. utkaṭa-¹ m. 'Saccharum sara or similar grass' Suśr., 'fragrant bark of Laurus cassia', °ṭā- f. 'the plant' lex.

1596 iṣukā́ f. 'arrow' AV. [íṣu- f. RV., n. BHSk., Pk. isu- m.]
1600 íṣṭakā f. 'brick' VS., iṣṭikā- f. MBh., iṣṭā- f. BHSk. [Av. ištya- n. Mayrhofer EWA i 94 and 557 with lit
1612 *īdhra 'clear sky'. 2. *īdhᵃra- [īdhríya- 'belonging to the clear sky' TS.]

1665 *ujjāgrat 'awake'. [Cf. jā́garti RV. and ujjāgarayati 'awakens' Sāh., Pk. ujjāgara-, ujjāara- m. 'lack of sleep': √jāgr̥]
1671 újjvalati 'blazes up, shines' TS. 2. *ujjvālayati, újjval° 'causes to shine' ŚBr. 3. *ujjuvālayati.
1674 ujjháti 'leaves, escapes' MBh. [Formed from pp. ujjhita- < *ud-źhita- and replacing *ujjahāti, Pa. ujjahati: Mayrhofer EWA i 100 with lit.: √hā³]
1680 úñchati or uñcháti 'gleans' ŚāṅkhGr̥. [√uñch: derivation < ucci- with P. Tedesco JAOS 77, 193 ff. phonet. unacceptable].

1699 uṇḍuka m. 'net, chignon, part of the body' Suśr. [Cf. uṇḍēraka- m. 'ball of flour, loaf, roll', uṇḍērakasraj- f. 'balls of meal on a string' Yājñ.: belongs to iṇḍvà- and the group of words collected under vīṭā- and is prob. ← Drav. cf. Tam. uṇṭai 'ball' Mal. uṇḍa, Kan. Tu. uṇḍe]

1765 uttamá 'highest, the most removed in order or time' RV. [ud¹]
1766 *uttamaputra 'the son most removed in order'. [uttamá-, putrá-]
1767 úttara 'upper' RV., 'northern' AV., 'following, future' RV. 2. n. (sc. vākyam) 'answer' R. [ud¹]

1853 *ut-śīrṣa-, ucchīrṣaka- m. 'one who has raised his head' Suśr., n. 'pillow' Mn. [Cf. *ut-śiras-: śīrṣá-]
1857a †*ut-śrayaṇa-, ucchrayaṇa- n. 'raising, erecting' KātyŚr. (cf. ucchraya- m. 'height of tree or mountain etc.' MBh.). [√śri]
1860 *ut-śrāya-, ucchrāyīˊ- f. 'raised piece of wood', °ya- m. 'elevation, height', ucchraya- m. Yājñ. [Cf. samucchraya- m., Pa. samussaya- m. 'accumulation': √śri]

1886 *utsukya 'eagerness'. [Cf. utsuka- 'anxious, eager' MBh., Pa. ussuka- 'eager', NiDoc. osuǵa-, Pk. ucchua-, ussuga-, ōsua-; autsukya- n. 'longing for' MBh., NiDoc. osukya-. Pa. uss- regularly < ut-s- contradicts the theory of Wackernagel and Debrunner KZ 67, 155 f., accepted by EWA i 9, of hypersanskritism < MIA. *icchua- (cf. Sk. Pk. icchu-)
1890 utsr̥ṣṭa 'let loose, abandoned' MBh. [útsr̥jati 'lets loose' RV., Pa. ussajjati: √sr̥j]
1900 *ut-sthāti 'stands up'. 2. Reformed as *utthāti. [úttiṣṭhati, udásthāt RV.; pres. -*sthāti formed after -sthā- in aor., fut., inf., and ger.: √sthā]
1901 *ut-sthāna 'act of rising'. 2. Reformed as utthā́na- n. ŚBr, 'starting on an expedition' Mn., 'manly effort' MBh. [√sthā]
1904 *ut-sthāpyatē 'is raised'. [utthāpya- 'to be raised, to be sent away' AitBr.: √sthā]
1924 údañcati 'raises, throws up' RV., 'ladles out' AV. 2. *upāñcati, úpācati 'lifts up e.g. water' ŚBr. [Phon. the mod. forms may derive from either: √añc]

1934 udācāra m. 'place for walking' Āp. [Cf. udā́carati 'rises out of' RV.: √car]

1942 udumbára-, udú° m. 'the tree Ficus glomerata' TS., n. 'its fruit' ŚBr. 2. uḍumbára- m. AV. 3. *dumbara. 4. *ḍumbara-. [Prob. ← Austro-as. EWA i 104 with lit.]
1944 údēti 'goes up, rises' RV. 2. údita-¹ 'risen' RV. 3. *udāyayati 'causes to rise'. [√i²]
1947 *udgamati 'comes forth, rises'. [Orig. subj. of aor. in udáganma 1st pl. RV.: √gam]
1948 udgamana n. 'coming forth' R., 'rising (of a star)' Pāṇ [√gam]
1953 udgalati¹ 'trickles out, oozes out, drips' BhP. 2. *udgālayati¹ 'causes to ooze out'. [~ *udgarati¹: √gal¹, √*gr̥̄¹]
1954 *udgāti 'rises, comes forth'. [Orig. subj. of aor. údagāt RV. 'has risen (of sun)': √gā]
1955 udgāthā f. 'a variety of Āryā metre' Colebrooke. [Cf. udgīthá- m. AV.: gā́thā-, √gai]
1956 *udgāmayati 'causes to rise or issue'. [Cf. udgamayati 'causes to issue' Pat., Pk. uggamiya- 'produced': √gam]
1961 údguratē 'lifts up, raises a weapon, raises the voice threateningly' VS. 2. *udgirati¹. 3. *udgurita- (replacing udgūrṇa- n. 'threatening' Yājñ.) [See *udgārayati¹, *udgr̥ta-: √gur¹]
1965 udgráhaṇa n. 'act of taking out' ŚBr., udgrabhaṇa- n. 'act of raising' KātyŚr. [√grah]
1967 udgrāhayati 'causes to take up, causes to pay' Yājñ. 2. Pp. udgrāhita-. [√grah]
1969 *udghata 'raised, opened'. [< IE *-gʷhn̊to- ? Replaced anal. by uddhata-, after úddhanti < *-gʷhen-: √han¹]
1971 *udgharati² 'lifts up'. 2. Caus. *udghārayati. 3. Pp. *udghr̥ta-. [Hardly conn. with hárati which is IE. *ĝher-]
1972 udghāṭa m. 'act of opening' Subh. 2. *udghāṭaka-¹ 'open'. 3. *udghāṭikā- 'open platform for watching from', udghāṭa- m. 'watchhouse' lex. [√ghaṭ]
1973 udghāṭaka² n. 'leather bucket for drawing water' lex. [Poss. conn. with udghāṭaka- m. 'key' Mr̥cch. and udghāṭa-: √ghaṭ]
1982 *uddanta 'without teeth'. [Replaces adantáka- TS., adánt° ŚBr. (~ uddantura- 'formidable' lex., Pk. uddaṁtura- 'with projecting teeth')
1986 *uddāta 'cleansed, bright, clear'. [Cf. avadāta- 'cleansed, pure, dazzling white' MBh., Pa. ōdāta-, Pk. avadāya-: √dai]

1990 uddāla¹ m. 'the tree Cordia myxa or latifolia', °aka- m. Suśr. [Poss. conn. with kuddāla-²: note esp. H. uṛāl and Or. kudāḷa 'Bauhinea variegata']
1994 úddīpyatē 'blazes up' ŚBr. [Cf. úddīpayati 'inflames' AV., Pa. uddīpanā- f. 'explanation', Pk. uddīvia- 'kindled'; uddīpta- 'flaming' lex., Pk. udditta-: √dīp]
1997 *uddēkṣati 'looks for, expects'. 2. *uddēkṣā-. [Formed from *dēkṣati after údīkṣatē ŚBr.: √īkṣ and √dr̥ś]
2001 *uddrāti 'flees, flies'. [Cf. uddrāvá- 'running away' VS., m. 'going upwards' Pāṇ.: √drā]
2007 úddhanti 'lifts up' RV., 'turns up the earth' TS. [√han¹]

2009 úddharati 'takes out' RV., 'rescues, ladles up' AV., 'raises' TS. 2. úddhr̥ta- 'drawn up or out' AV. 3. uddhārayati 'raises'. 4. *ūḍhārayati < *udᶻdh- (= Av. uz-d-)? [ud-hr̥- and ud-dhr̥ collide, but Pa. absol. ūhacca is < *uhhr̥tya < ud-hr̥tya with assimilation of unexploded -d to h-: √hr̥ or √dhr̥]

2021 uddhí m. 'seat of a carriage' AV., 'earthen stand on which the ukhā rests' ŚBr. [√dhā]
2024 *uddhuvati, or *uddhavati 'shakes up'. [Cf. dhuváti AV., dhaváti Dhātup., úddhunōti 'shakes up' RV., Pk. uddhuṇiya-, °ūṇiya- 'blown by the wind, scattered': √dhū]
2026 uddhūta, °dhuta- 'shaken, shaken off, thrown up' MBh. [Cf. úddhū˘nōti RV.: √dhū]
2027 uddhūlayati 'sprinkles with powder' Kathās. 2. uddhūlana- n. 'act of so doing' Bālar. [*dhūḍi-]
2028 uddhmāna n. 'fire-place' lex. [Perh. re-sanskritization of uddhāna-¹; but semant. cf. udvāna-³ with which it would collide in Paš. and Si.: √dham]
2030 *uddhrasā 'coughing up'. [dhrasnāti 'casts up', udhrasnāti 'throws up, gleans', perf. udhrasāṁ babhūva, udhrāsayati Dhātup. for uddhr° E. H. Johnston JRAS 1931, 571: √dhras]

2032 *uddhvalati 'goes astray'. 2. *uddhvālayati 'leads astray'. 3. *uddhvāla-. [Prob. cmpd. of hválati 'goes astray' ŚBr. = hváratē RV., hvālayati 'shakes' Bhaṭṭ.; but poss., in view of forms with ūḍh- (if < *udᶻdh-), cmpd. of *dhvalati = dhvárati 'bends, makes fall' Dhātup., 3 pl. aor. mid. ádhūrṣata RV.: √hval (√hvr̥) or √dhvr̥]
2048 udyama m. 'act of raising' Yājñ., 'undertaking, striving after, zeal' R. [√yam]
2049 *udyamati, údyacchati 'raises' RV., 'undertakes, is diligent' MBh. 2. udyamana- n. 'raising' Pāṇ., 'exertion' Daś. [√yam]
2050 *udyasati 'is eager for' [Cf. udyāsá- m. 'exertion, effort' VS., yásyati 'froths up' RV., 'heats or exerts oneself' Car., yasati Pāṇ.: √yas]
2052 udyā́na n. 'going out' AV. 2. 'park, garden' Yājñ., °aka- n. R. [√yā]
2057 udra² 'water' in anudrá- 'waterless', udrín- 'abounding in water' RV. 2. ulla-² 'wet' BHSk. [udán-: ud²]
2058 *udraṁhati 'jumps up'. 2. Caus. *udraṁhayati. [ráṁhati 'hastens' RV., raṅghatē Bhaṭṭ., láṅghati 'jumps' Dhātup., all < IE. *legʷh- IEW 660: √raṁh]
2060 *udrikhati, úllikhati 'makes an incision or furrow' ŚBr., 'scratches' AśvGr̥. [√rikh¹]

2061 údricyatē 'is prominent' RV. 2. *udriñcati 'empties'. 3. údrikta- 'superfluous' TS. 4. *udrēcati 'leaves'. 5. udrēcayati 'causes to increase' Rājat. 6. *udrēcyatē 'is poured out'. [All later forms have basic meaning of uncompounded ric- 'leave, empty, pour' cf. Pa. uddēkanika- 'spouting' ZDMG 114, 445 < udrēka-: √ric]
2063 *udrīyatē 'runs out, is dissolved, is broken'. 2. *udrīṇa-. 3. *udrēpayati. [riṇā́ti 'lets go' RV., rīˊyatē 'is dissolved, is shattered' RV., rīṇa- 'dissolved' Śiś., rēpayati Gr.: √rī]
2066 *udrēkha 'scratching, drawing', ullēkha- 'causing to appear clearly', °khā- f. 'stroke, line' lex. [√rikh¹]
2071 údvartatē 'bursts open, is puffed up with pride, originates' ŚBr., 'rises, swells' Suśr. 2. udvr̥tta- 'turned up, opened' MBh. 3. údvartayati 'breaks in pieces' RV. [√vr̥t¹]
2072 udvartana n. 'pounding, rubbing and kneading the body, unguents used therefor' Yājñ. [√vr̥t¹]
2078 udvāna³, uddā° n. 'stove' lex. [Semant. cf. uddhmāna- with which it would collide in Paš. and Si.: √vā²]

2081 údvāyati 'is extinguished, is exhausted' TS. 2. údvāpayati¹ 'extinguishes' TBr. 3. udvāna-¹ n. 'being extinguished' Nyāyam. [vā́yati 'is exhausted' RV., 'dries up' Dhātup., vāna-, vāta- 'dried up' lex. Merges with údvāti 'is blown out' AitBr.: √vā² and √vai]
2085 udvāhanī f. 'rope' lex., °na- n. 'anything that lifts' lex. [udvahana- n. 'lifting up' Suśr., Pk. uvvahaṇa- n.: √vah]
2091 udvēṣṭatē 'winds or twists upwards' MBh. 2. udvēṣṭana- n. 'wrapping, contraction, pain in the back' Suśr. [√vēṣṭ]
2095 undura m. 'rat, mouse' Suśr., °duru-, °daru- m. lex. 2. indūra- m. lex. [← Austro-as. EWA i 105 with lit.]

2098 unnaḍa 'arrogant' BHS ii 132, more prob. 'boisterous' Brough Dhp 279. [Perh. < *un-nr̥t-a- (Brough loc. cit. with lit.) cf. unnaṭati 'jumps' Kāś. on Pāṇ. and poss. semantic contamination with unnatá- in BHSk. 'arrogant', Pk. uṇṇaya- and with unnaddha- 'impudent' MBh
2099 unnatá 'having a large hump' VS., 'raised, high' MBh., n. 'elevated part' TS. [√nam]
2101 únnayati 'leads out or up, sets up, frees from' RV. 2. únnīta- 'led up' RV. [√nī]
2103 *unnahati 'unties'. [unnahyati 'frees, unties' Suśr., 'frees oneself, rushes out' MBh., unnahana- 'unfettered' BhP.: √nah]
2106 unnābha '*tearing open' (m. 'name of a king' Kālid.). [únnambhayati 'tears open' TS.: √nabh]
2113 *unmathyatē 'is stirred up' 2. unmathayati 'shakes, excites' BhP. 3. *unmāthayati. [unmathnāti 'disturbs, rouses' PārGr̥., mathyátē 'is stirred' RV., māthayati MBh.: √manth]
2114 unmada 'mad, drunk' Kālid. or unmāda- 'mad' BhP., m. 'intoxication' MBh. [√mad¹]
2121 unmāna n. 'weight, value' ŚBr., 'measure of height or length' VarBr̥S. [√mā]
2137 *upakanīyas 'next younger'. [Cf. upakaniṣṭhikā- f. 'finger next the little finger' ĀśvGr̥. and kánīyas-- 'younger' RV., Pa. kaniya-, Pk. kaṇīa-, °ṇīasa-: *kana-]
2139 úpakarōti 'takes care of' ŚBr., 'provides' Mn., 'helps' R. [Cf. upaskurutē 'adorns' Pāṇ.; √kr̥¹]
2141 upakāra m. 'help, use' MBh., 'embellishment (as a gate with garlands)' Suśr. [√kr̥¹]

2144 *upakāla 'summer'. [Semant. cf. Psht. psarlai 'spring' < *upa-sarada-ka- (where sarad- is 'summer') and similar time and season names in Sk.: upaparvan- 'the day before the Parvan', upapūrvarātram 'towards the beginning of night': EVP 60. Did kālá-² which gives 'year' in Sh. mean 'autumn' or 'winter'?]
2147 *upakr̥kāṭī 'part near the back of the neck'. [kr̥kā- ṭikā-]

2155 upagīti f. 'a variety of āryā metre'. [Cf. upagīthá- n. MaitrS., upagātŕ̥- m. 'one who accompanies the song of udgātṛ' TS.: √gai]
2156 *upagr̥bhāyati, úpagr̥hṇāti 'seizes from below' AV., 'collects' TS., 'takes possession of' MBh. 2. *upaghr̥pta-. [√grah]
2157 upagraha m. 'a handful (of kuśa grass)' KātyŚr. [Cf. upagrahaṇa- n. 'act of seizing' ib.: √grah]
2158 *upaghrāyati 'smells at'. [Cf. upaghrā́yam 'smelling at' MaitrS., úpaghrāpayati 'causes to smell at' TS. upajaghrau 'kissed' Kālid. √ghrā]
2162 *upacāyayati 'heaps up'. [úpacinōti 'heaps up' TS., Pa. upacināti; Pk. uvacayaṇa- n. 'growth'; cāyayati, cāpayati Pāṇ.: √ci¹]
2165 upacít f. 'a partic. disease, a kind of swelling' VS. [√ci¹]
2166 upacīyatē 'is heaped together, is strong, succeeds' MBh. 2. upacita- 'heaped up, prosperous' MBh., 'strong, fat' Suśr. [√ci¹]
2176 *upatimyati 'wets'. [For upa with a verb 'to wet' cf. úpōnatti ŚBr., úpōtta-: √tim]
2176a †upadarśayati 'causes to appear, illudes' Kathās., 'illustrates' Yājñ., úpadadarśa- RV. [√dr̥ś]

2178 upadīˊka m., °kā- f. 'species of ant' ŚBr., upacīˊka- m. AV. (Ppp.), upajīˊka- m. AV. 2. uddēhikā- f. 'white ant' Hār. 3. upadēhikā- f. lex. [With uddēhikā- which is poss. ancient Bartholomae AirWb 411 compares Av. uzdaēza- m. 'piling up earth', uzdaēzay- m. 'wall'. But in addition to the preceding cf. also upajíhvikā- f. RV., upadīpikā-, uddīpikā-, upādikā-, utpādikā- f. lex. This variety of forms was attributed by Wackernagel AiGr ii 1, 11 with lit., and ii 2, 316 to popular etymology. Taboo also prob. played a part. Very aberrant Pk. ōliṁbhā- perh. infl. by ōliṁpaï 'smears']
2181 úpadravati 'rushes at, attacks' RV. 2. *upadrā- vayati 'causes to be attacked'. [√dru]
2191 úpapadyatē 'goes towards, attacks' AV., 'approaches for help' AitBr., 'enters' MBh., 'is produced' Kauś., 'is suitable' MBh. 2. upapanna- Yājñ. [√pad¹]
2206 úpayacchati 'lays hold of, takes' RV. or *upāyacchati cf. ā́yacchati. [√yam]
2211 *uparaṭati 'shouts to'. [úpa with 'to call' cf. úpahvayatē RV., upārudati Bhaṭṭ.: √raṭ]

2223 úpala m. 'stone, rock' MBh., °aka- m. 'precious stone' Suśr., 'upper millstone (?)' in upala-prakṣín- RV., úpalā- f. 'upper and smaller millstone' ŚBr. 2. *upalla-. 3. *pala- or *palla-. [EWAi 106 l-form of úpara-; but more general meaning 'rock, stone' suggests another origin. Then upalā- f. might be primarily the smaller of the two millstones, but influenced semant. by úpara-]
2230 *upalābhayati 'causes to obtain'. [upalabhatē 'obtains' MBh., Pk. uvalabhaï; caus. upalambhayati BhP., Pk. uvalaṁbhaï 'obtains': √labh]
2240 upavartatē 'walks on' ĀśvŚr., 'returns' R., upā́vartatē 'approaches' RV., 'returns' MBh., upā́vartayati 'causes to turn to' ŚBr. [√vr̥t¹]
2247 úpavīta 'invested with the thread', n. 'the sacred thread' Kālid. [√vyē]
2251 upavēṣṭayati 'wrap up' MW., upavēṣṭitin- 'one who has wrapped a cloth round his loins' Āp. [√vēṣṭ]
2254 úpaśrayati tr. 'leans against' ŚBr., upāśrayati Mn. [Cf. upāśraya- m. 'refuge' MBh., Pa. upassaya- m. 'resting place', Pk. uvassaya-, uvāsaya- m.: √śri]

2260 *upasariyā, upasaryā- f. 'one to be impregnated' Pāṇ. [upasara- m. 'approach of a male to a female, covering (a cow)' Pāṇ.: √sr̥]
2261 upasḗcana 'pouring on' RV., n. 'sprinkling on' RV., 'infusion, juice' AV. [√sic]
2263 *upaskadati 'jumps towards'. 2. *upaskatta-. [Cf. inf. skádē, skádaḥ RV., aor. askadat Gr., upaskanna- 'attacked' R.: √skand]
2268 upastára m. 'anything laid under' AV. [Cf. upastír- f. 'cover' RV.: √str̥]
2269 *upastarati, úpastr̥ṇāti 'spreads over, scatters under' RV., upāstarati VarBr̥S. 2. upastáraṇa- n. 'cover' RV., 'undermattress' ĀśvGr̥. 3. *upastr̥ta- 'spread over'. [√str̥]
2271 upástha¹ m. 'lap, sheltered or secure place' RV. [√sthā]
2274 *upasthāti 'stands near', upasthita- 'approached' ĀśvGr̥S. [úpatiṣṭhati 'stands near' RV., 'attends on' MBh.: √sthā]
2281 úpaharati 'brings near, offers (food)' AV., 'takes away' MBh., °tē 'accepts' TS. [√hr̥]
2282 upahāsá m. 'sport' ŚBr., 'laughter' Kathās., upahāsya- 'to be laughed at'. [√has]
2284 upā́karōti 'fetches (úpa ā́ akaram RV.), makes preparation (for a sacred ceremonial), undertakes, begins' TS., 'consecrates' Mn. [√kr̥¹]
2287 upākṣa¹, °aka- m. 'part of cart which adjoins axletree' lex. 2. '*adjoining the shoulder'. [ákṣa-¹]
2298 *upāñjali 'putting the open hands together'. [Cf. upa-hasta- m. 'act of taking with the hand' Pāṇ.: añjalí-]
2299 upādhi¹ m. 'point of view, aim' Car., upā́hita- 'set out, proposed as prize' ŚBr. [√dhā]
2302 upānáh f. 'shoe, sandal' TS., upānaha- m. MBh. (prāṇāhitā- f. 'shoe' lex. sanskritization of MIA. *pāṇah-). [√nah]
2303 upāntá n. 'border, edge', °tḗ 'near the end' TS. [Cf. Psht. bānde 'upon' < *upā̆ntai EVP 15: ánta-]
2304 upāntika n. 'nearness', °tam 'near' R. [antika- or poss. *upānti in Pa. upanti 'near': ánti¹]

2312 upā́labhatē 'touches' ŚBr., 'lays hold of, kills, censures' ChUp. 2. *upālābhayati. [√labh]
2323 *upēṣayati 'sends on'. [Cf. upaprḗṣyati 'drives on' AV.: prob. to be separated from úpēṣatē 'attacks' RV. < upa īṣ-: √iṣ¹]
2327 úpōdaka 'near to water' VS., n. 'the plant Basella cordifolia' Suśr. [udaká-]
2332 *upparabhūmi 'upper ground'. [Cf. uparibhūmí adv. 'above the ground' ŚBr.: *uppara-, bhūˊmi-]
2337 *ubbakka 'vomited'. [S. uḇ-, G. M. ub- point to earlier *ubb- (< *udb- ?) rather than *uvv- as in Pk. (< *udvakka- replacing udvānta-)]

2339 *ubbal 'rise, swell, boil'. 2. *ubbāl- tr. [Morgenstierne AO xviii 222 derives from ud-val-, Sk. vā̆layati, ONorwegian vella 'boil', IE. *wel- IEW 1140. If so forms of K. G.M. with b and S. with ḇ must be ← Centre, since -d-v- > Pk. -vv- and in these languages -v-. Poss., with *ubbar-, *ubbār- above, due to coalescence of ud-val- with ud-bhar- s.v. údbharati; but cf. also a similar series s.v. *ummaḍ-.
2341 umbara, °bura- m. 'upper timber of a door-frame' lex.
2342 *umbāḍa 'firebrand'. [Conn. doubtful with úlmuka- m. AitBr., Pk. ummua- n.]
2343 umbī f. 'fried stalks of wheat or barley', °bikā- f., ulumbā- f. lex.
2352 úrā f. 'ewe' RV. [Cf. urabhra- m. 'ram' Suśr., Pa. Pk. urabbha- m.]

2356 *urvara 'surplus, left over', urvarita- 'left over' BhP. [Poss. with EWA i 110 hyper-sanskritism fr. Pk., but perh. conn. with ulvaṇá-, ulba° 'excessive', Pk. ullaṇa-, uvvaṇa- ubba° and with urvárī- f. 'wife presented with many others for choice' AV., Pa. ubbarī- f. 'concubine'. S. with b and ḇ indicates early MIA. -vv- and -bb-]
2357 úlapa m. 'bush, shrub, grass' RV., 'the grass Saccharum cylindricum' lex., ulū˘pa-, ulūka-² m. lex. [Cf. ulapyà- 'having to do with u°' VS., °pyá- MaitrS.]

2360 ulūˊkhala n. 'a wooden mortar' RV., aulūkhalḗ 'pestle and mortar' MaitrS. 2. *ulukkhala-. 3. udūkhala- n. Suśr. 4. *udukkhala-. [← Drav. EWA 111 with lit. Like músala-, pop. derivative with -ala- J. Bloch BSOS v 742]
2362 ulkā́ f. 'meteor, fire falling from heaven' RV., 'fire-brand' ŚBr.
2375 ullasati 'shines out' BhP., 'sports' lex. 2. ullāsayati 'causes to dance' Kathās. 3. ullāsa- m. 'merriment' Kathās. 4. ullāsin- 'rejoicing'. [√las¹]
2376 ullāpayati 'coaxes' MārkP. [Cf. ullāpa- m. 'calling out in a loud voice, change of voice in grief or sickness', Pk. ullāva-, °lāya- m. 'noise, answer, change of voice': √lap]
2377 ullāla '*springing up or out' ('a sort of metre' lex.). [√lal]
2379 *ulluṇṭhati 'rolls to and fro'. [Cf. ulluṇṭhana- 'rolling' Apte, ulluṭhati 'moves violently to and fro' lex., luṇṭhita- 'set in motion' Hariv.: √luṭh]
2382 *ullōpana 'taking out'. [Cf. úllupta- 'taken or drawn out' AV., ullōpam Kauś., Pa. ullumpati 'takes out, saves': √lup]
2384 uśīra m.n. 'fragrant root of the grass Andropogon muricatum' Suśr., °rī f. 'a species of grass' lex., ūrṣā-¹ f. 'Andropogon serratum'.
2387 úṣṭra m. 'buffalo' RV., 'camel' MBh. [Cf. uṣṭŕ̥- m. 'bull drawing a plough' RV.]
2390 uṣṇa² m. 'onion' lex., °ṇā- f. 'name of a plant' Nigh. [Same as uṣṇá-¹?]
2399 usrá m. 'ray, sun, day', usŕ̥- f. 'morning light', usrā́- f. 'daybreak, cow' RV. [√vas³]
2417 ūˊbadhya or ūˊva° n. 'undigested grass &c. in the stomach of an animal killed for sacrifice' RV. 2. *ubbadhya-.
2422 ūrjas n. 'vigour, strength' Sāh., ūˊrj-, °jā́- f., °já- adj. RV. [√ūrj]
2423 ūrṇanā́bhi m. 'spider' TBr., °bha- m. ŚvetUp., °bhī- f. [ūˊrṇā-, nā́bhi-]
2430 ūrdhvajānu, °uka- 'raising the knees in sitting' ŚāṅkhŚr. [ūrdhvá-, jā́nu-]
2432 ūrdhvamukha 'having the mouth turned up' Kālid. [ūrdhvá-, múkha-]
2433 ūrdhvaśvāsa m. 'shortness of breath, asthma' Suśr. [ūrdhvá-, śvāsa-]
2435 ūrdhvasthiti f. 'standing up, horse's back, elevation' lex. [ūrdhvá-, sthíti-]
2438 *ūrṣā² 'wool'. [< IE. *wlHso-, cf. Lat. vellus < *welsos, IIFL iii 3, 27 with (?): ūˊrṇā-]
2439 ūˊṣa m. 'salt ground' TS., ūṣā-, ūṣī- f. KātyŚr., 'salt' in ūṣapuṭá- m. 'box of salt' MaitrS.
2441 ūṣmán m. 'heat, steam' AV., uṣman- m., ūṣmā- f. MBh., °maka- m. lex. [√vas³]
2444 ūˊhati 'suppose' MBh. [From perf. st. of ūhḗ J. Wackernagel KZ 41, 309, pres. ṓhatē RV.: √ūh²]
2445 ŕ̥kṣa m. 'bear' RV., °ṣī- f. MBh., accha- m. lex.
2454 *r̥tuvanta-, r̥tvanta- m. 'end of the (rainy?) season' Mn. [Cf. ánta r̥tūˊnāṁ hēmantáḥ ŚBr.: r̥tú-, ánta-]

2457 r̥dháti (a) 'increases, prospers, succeeds' RV. 2. ŕ̥dhyati Dhātup. 3. r̥ddha-. (b) '*cooks, is cooked': 1. ŕ̥dhyati. 2. r̥ddha-. 3. *r̥ndhati (cf. r̥ṇáddhi 'increases' RV.) [P. Tedesco BSL 72, 114 (see ND 537 a 34) derives the group 'be prosperous or pleased' — Pk. rijjhaï, riddha-, &c
2462 ḗka 'one' RV. 2. Replaced by *ēkka- either with emph. doubling (as in Pk. igga-) or as MIA. loan from Sk. when single -k- was no longer a sound of the language.
2466 ēkacchattra 'ruled by one king only' BhP. 2. With -kk-. [ḗka-, cháttra-¹]
2468 ēkatra 'in one (with noun in loc.), in one place' Yājñ. [ḗka-]
2474 ēkabhakta n. 'eating only one meal a day' Kauś. 2. With -kk-. [ḗka-, bhakta-]
2484 *ēkāṇḍin, ēkāṇḍa- 'having one testicle only (of a horse)'. [ḗka-, āṇḍá-]
2486 ēkādaśá², 'eleventh' RV., °śī- f. 'eleventh day of the fortnight' MBh. [ḗkādaśa¹]
2489 ēkārtha 'having the same purpose' KātyŚr., 'having the same meaning' Nir. 2. With -kk-. [ḗka-, ártha-]
2492 *ēkāhika 'having interval of one day'. 2. With -kk-. [ēkāhá- m. 'ceremony lasting one day' ŚBr., 'period of one day' Pāṇ., Pa. ēkāha- m., Pk. ēgāha- m.n.: ḗka-, áhar-]
2492a †ēkin- 'consisting of one' Lāṭy., cf. ēkīya- 'belonging to one' Gr̥hyas. [ḗka-]
2511 ḗṭatē 'goes' lex. [Cf. iḍvara- m. 'bull to be set at liberty' ~ itvará- 'id.' lex.?]
2512 ēḍa m. 'a kind of sheep' KātyŚr., ēḍī- f., ēḍaka-¹ m. 'a sheep or goat', aiḍa- 'ovine' MBh., aiḍaká m. 'a kind of sheep' ŚBr., iḍikka- f. 'wild goat' lex. [← Drav. EWA i 126 with lit.]

2522 ēlā f. 'cardamum' Suśr. [← Drav. EWA i 561 with lit
2523 ēluka n. 'a kind of fragrant substance' Suśr. [Cf. ēlavālu-]
2530 ēṣá¹ nom. sg. m. 'this' RV., f. ēṣā, all other cases from ēta-: n. sg. ētad, m.n. gen. sg. ētasya.
2535 aindrá 'belonging to Indra' AV., n. 'wild ginger', °drī- f. 'a kind of cucumber' lex. [índra-]
2539 *ōggara 'gruel'. [← Turk. ögrä, ükrä, üg° 'soup' Brockelmann Mitteltürk. Wb. 235, 'vermicelli' Radloff Vergl. Wb. i 1813]

2544 *ōṭṭā 'shelter, screen'. 2. *ōttā-, which is therefore prob. not < *apagupta- or *avag°. 3. *ōḍḍā-. [Poss. further conn. with *ōḍḍh- 'dress, cover', but to be separated from forms < *apaghaṭya-, °ghāṭa-, °ghāṭayati]

2547 *ōḍḍh 'put on, wear, cover'. [← Drav. cf. Tam. uṭu-, Kan. uḍu- 'to dress', Tel. uḍupu 'dress' (though ac. to T. Burrow BSOAS xii 134 < *cuṭu). The forms of all languages (except Tir., see below) must or may contain -ḍḍh-: conn. therefore with váhati 'wears clothes' Mr̥cch. (vṓḍhum LM 302) is unlikely.]
2549 ōḍra¹ m. 'a tribe of Śūdras' Mn., 'name of a people' MBh., uḍra-, auḍ°. 2. *auḍrika- 'of that people'. [S. Lévi JA 1923, 20 ff., EWA i 132]
2550 ōḍra² m. 'the China rose, Hibiscus rosa sinensis'.
2552 ōdaná n.m. 'grain mashed and cooked with milk' RV., 'boiled rice' Kāś. on Pāṇ. [EWA i 132: √ud²?]
2558 ōlla¹ n. 'the esculent root Arum campanulatum', ōla- n. lex., aula- n., ulla-¹ m., ullī- f. Nigh.
2564 ōṣṭhī f. 'the plant Coccinia grandis (with the red fruit to which lips are compared)' lex. [ṓṣṭha-]
2565 aughá m. 'flood, stream' ŚBr., ōgha- m. MBh., 'quantity' MBh.
2567 audikā f. adj. scil. dŕ̥ti-, °daka- MBh. 'relating to water'. [udaká-: √ud²]
2571 auṣadhá 'consisting of herbs', n. 'herbs in general, a herb' ŚBr. [ṓṣadhi-]
2572 áuṣṭraka 'of a camel' Pāṇ., auṣṭra- Mn., n. 'the camel genus' W. 2. auṣṭrika- Suśr., m. 'oilmiller' MBh. [úṣṭra-]
2574 ká², nom. sg. m. káḥ, f. kā́, n. kím q.v., gen. sg. m.n. kásya, inst. kḗna. In nom. m.f. largely replaced by kaḥ punar and kō'paraḥ.

2576 kaṁsá¹ m. 'metal cup' AV., m.n. 'bell-metal' Pat. as in S., but would in Pa. Pk. and most NIA. lggs. collide with kā́ṁsya- to which L. P. testify and under which the remaining forms for the metal are listed. 2. *kaṁsikā-.
2577 kaṁsa² m. 'name of a king of Mathurā' MBh.
2582 *kakudiṣṭha 'on the hump'. [For formation cf. *kākutstha-: loc. sg. kakúd-, stha-]
2584 kakubhá 'lofty' VS., kakuhá- RV. 2. m. 'the tree Terminalia arjuna' MBh. [Cf. kakúbh- f. 'peak' RV. and *kakudha- with similar meanings]
2585 kakkaṭá¹ m. 'a kind of animal (offered at sacrifice to the goddess Anumati)' VS., katkaṭá- TS.

2586 kakkōla m. 'a species of plant with a berry the inner part of which is waxy and aromatic' R., n. 'its perfume', °aka- n. Suśr., °likā- f. 'a plant' lex. 2. takkōla- m. 'Pimenta acris' R. [Cf. kākōli- f. 'a medicinal plant' Suśr., °lī- Car., kōlaka- n. 'a kind of perfume' Bhpr.; karkōṭa- cf. esp. G. kãkoṛũ 'Myrtus pimenta'.]
2588 kákṣa¹ m. 'armpit' RV., 'groin (?)' AV., kakṣā- f. 'armpit' Suśr. which despite EWA i 561 (correcting i 136) is to be distinguished from kakṣyāˋ- 'girdle'.
2589 kákṣa² m. 'undergrowth' RV. (?), VS. 'dead wood' VS., 'grass' lex.
2591 *kakṣapuṭī, kakṣapuṭa- m. 'armpit' as title of a work. [kákṣa-¹, puṭa-]

2592 kakṣyāˋ f. 'girdle, girth' RV., kakṣyà- 'pertaining to a girdle, girded (?)' RV., 'girth' in kakṣyaprā́-; kakṣā- f. 'girdle' MBh., 'loincloth' BhP., kakṣa- m. 'girdle' MBh., 'end of lower garment, hem' BhP. both prob. with kṣ for kṣy. [kákṣa-¹]

2595 kaṅká m. 'heron' VS. [← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 87; onomat. Mayrhofer EWA i 137. Drav. influence certain in o of M. and Si.: Tam. Kan. Mal. kokku 'crane', Tu. korṅgu, Tel. koṅga, Kuvi koṅgi, Kui kohko]
2596 kaṅkaṭa¹ m. pl. 'name of a people' VarBr̥S.
2597 kaṅkaṇa n. 'bracelet' MBh., °ṇī- f. 'ornament with bells' lex.
2598 káṅkata m. 'comb' AV., n. lex., °tī-, °tikã- f. lex. 2. *kaṅkaṭa-². 3. *kaṅkaśa-. [Of doubtful IE. origin WP i 335, EWA i 137: aberrant -uta- as well as -aśa- replacing -ata- in MIA. and NIA.]

2601 kaṅkara¹ n. 'buttermilk mixed with water' lex. [Suggesting non-Aryan (Drav.?) source EWA i 143 groups with kaccara-¹, kaṭvará-, kaṭura-, kadvara- n. 'milk with water', kadara- n. 'a partic. milk product' lex.]
2604 *kaṅkāla² 'poor, miserable'. [Poss. same as kaṅkāla-¹ which in Pa. has a for ā, as in kaṅkara-²]

2605 kaṅku m. 'a panic seed' VarBr̥S. 2. kaṅgu- f. 'Panicum italicum' VarBr̥S., °gū- f. lex. °guka- m., °gukā- f., gaṅkuka- m. Suśr. [A word of the Mlecchas for Aryan yava- according to Gotama Nyāya-sūtra 2, 56, quoted by Mayrhofer EWA i 138, who comparing priyáṅgu- as a pop. etymology of a form with initial p- suggests Austro-as. origin. This is further borne out by the form *ṭaṅgunī- s.v. *kaṅkunī-]
2608 *kaṅgunītaila 'oil made from the millet Panicum italicum'. [*kaṅkunī-, tailá-]
2609 kacu f. 'the esculent root of Arum colocasia.' [Cf kacvī- f., kēcuka- m. 'Colocasia antiquorum', kēmuka-]

2610 *kacc¹ 'pull'. [Cf. kácatē 'fastens' Dhātup., kacākaci 'mutual pulling of hair' MBh., kaca- m. 'band, hem' lex., 'hair of head' Kālid., kacēla- m. 'string holding manuscript leaves together' lex.]

2615 kaccara¹ 'dirty, vile' lex. 2. *kassara-. [Sk., Pa. and Pk. have a series of somewhat similar words: kaṅkara- 'vile', kaṭvara- 'despised' which as n. subst., like kaṭura-, kadara-, kadvara- n., also mean 'whey'. Pa. kacavara- m. 'rubbish', Pk. kayavara-, kayāra- (J. Charpentier IL ii 47), kaccavāra- m.; kacchara-, kassa- m. 'mud' (LM 304)
2618 kaccha m. 'bank, shore, marshy ground' MBh. [Conn. with kákṣa- (EWA i 139) doubtful, but see kacchapa-]

2619 kacchapa m. 'turtle, tortoise' MBh. 2. *kacchabha-. [By pop. etym. through kaccha- for kaśyápa- VS. J. Charpentier MO xxvi 110 suggested equivalence in MIA. of kassa- = kaccha- to explain creation of kacchapa- ~ kassapa-. But K. kochuwᵘ, unless a loan from Ind., points to *kakṣapa-, which would make the formation earlier.]
2620 kacchurá 'affected with itch' Kāś. on Pāṇ. 2. kacchula- Mv. [kacchūˊ-]
2621 kacchūˊ f. 'itch, scab, cutaneous disease' Suśr. [Prob. like kharju-¹, khasa-¹ and poss. kaṇḍū- ← Drav. EWA i 139, 147 with lit.]
2622 kajjala n. 'lamp-black' Suśr. [← Drav. or Mu. EWA 139 with lit. Former might account for N. g-. J. Bloch BSOS v 738 puts it with kāla-¹ as ← Drav.]
2626 *kañcu 'skin of a snake'. 2. kañcuka- m. 'corselet, jacket' R., 'snake's slough' Pañcat., 'husk' BhP. [Poss. ← Mu. Kuiper AO xvi 307, EWA i 140]
2628 kañjala m. 'the bird Gracula religiosa', kañjaka-, °jana- m. lex.; kañjara- m. 'peacock' Apte, kañjāra- m. lex.

2629 káṭa¹ m. 'twist of straw, mat' TS., káṭaka- m.n. 'twist of straw' Kād., 'bridle ring' Suśr., 'bracelet' Kālid., kaṭikā- f. 'straw mat' KātyŚr. com. [Derivation as early MIA. form of *kr̥ta-² ~ kr̥ṇátti EWA i 141 is supported by S. P. L. forms of the latter q.v. In NIA., except in G., káṭa-¹ has developed as 'ring, bracelet, chain'.]
2631 kaṭa³ m. 'thin piece of wood, plank' lex.
2632 kaṭakaṭā 'sound of rubbing' MBh., kaṭakaṭāpayati 'makes a grating sound' R. 2. *kaṭakka-, kaḍatkr̥ta- n. 'noise'. [Cf. kiṭakiṭāyatē, khaṭakhaṭāyatē]
2638 kaṭāha¹ m. 'boiler, saucepan with handles' MBh., °aka- m., °hī- f. lex.
2639 kaṭi, °ṭīˊ- 'hip, buttocks' Mn., °ṭikā- f., °ṭa- 'hip' MBh. [IE. *{s}qI̊-to- WP ii 597: rather ← Drav., cf. Tam. kaḍam 'mountain side, elephant's temple', Kan. kaḍe 'side, end', Tel. kaḍa.]
2642 kaṭukarōhiṇī f. 'the plant Helleborus niger', kaṭur° Suśr., kaṭukār° Car. [kaṭú-, rṓhiṇī-]
2645 *kaṭṭa² 'young male animal'. [Cf. kaṭāha-² m. 'young male buffalo with horns just appearing' prob. ← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 368; *kaḍḍa-, *kēṭṭa-]

2649 kaṭphala m. 'the small tree Myrica sapida (of which bark and seeds are used medicinally and the fruit eaten)' Suśr. [kāphala- m. lex. sanskritized from one of the NIA. forms which depend on MIA. kapphala- and *kāipphala- or *kāyap° of unknown origin]
2650 kaṭhiná 'hard, stiff' Suśr. [EWA i 144 with lit. groups kaṭhiná-, káṭhōra-, °ōla-, kaṭhara-, kaḍḍati as ← Drav. Tam. kaṭṭu 'hardness', Tu. gaṭṭi, &c.]
2651 káṭhōra 'hard, solid, stiff' BhP., 'cruel' Pañcat., °ṭhōla-, °ṭhura-, °ṭhara- 'hard, cruel' lex. [See kaṭhiná-]
2653 kaḍambá, kalamba-¹, m. 'end, point, stalk of a potherb' lex. [See kadambá-]
2654 kaḍambī f. 'the potherb Convolvulus repens', °ba- m. Car., kalambī-, °bikā-, °bū-, °bukā- f. lex. [See kadambá-]
2655 káḍāra 'having projecting teeth' (for this meaning see H. Lüders AO xvi 131), karāla- (< *kaḷāra- J. Charpentier MO xxvi 150) 'gaping' R., 'gaping with projecting teeth' BhP., 'dreadful' MBh.

2656 kaḍēbara-, °ēpara-, °ēvara- n. 'body, corpse' BHSk., kalēvara- m.n. MBh. [← Austro-as.: ka-ḍēbara- as Pk. kā-liṁba- 'body' ~ ḍimba-² EWA i 182 with lit. But cf. kaṭa- 'corpse' lex. ← Tam. kaḍam 'body']
2661 káṇa m. 'a grain of corn' AV., 'drop (of water)' Kāv., kaṇikā- f. 'a single grain' MBh.
2665 kaṇika m. 'grain' BhP., 'meal of parched wheat' lex
2668 kaṇṭa¹ m. 'thorn' BhP. 2. káṇṭaka- m. 'thorn' ŚBr., 'anything pointed' R.
2672 kaṇṭakāra m. 'name of a plant' lex., °rī- f. 'Solanum jacquini' Suśr., 'Bombax heptaphyllum, Flacourtia sapida' lex., °raka- m. 'Solanum jacquini' lex., °rikā- f. Suśr. [kaṇṭa-¹]
2675 kaṇṭaphala m. 'name of various trees, the bread-fruit or jack-fruit tree' lex. [Cf. kaṇṭakāla-: kaṇṭa-¹, phála-¹?]
2676 kaṇṭala m. 'the thorny tree Mimosa arabica which yields gum arabic' lex. [kaṇṭa-¹]
2677 *kaṇṭavēlli 'a thorny creeper', cf. kaṇṭavalli- f. 'Acacia concinna' lex. [kaṇṭa-¹, vēlli-]
2680 kaṇṭhá m. (a) 'throat, neck' ŚBr. (b) 'narrowest part of a hole' Suśr. (c) 'voice' MBh., 'sound' W. (d) '*border, immediate proximity' Pañcat.
2682 kaṇṭhamaṇi m. 'jewel worn on neck' lex. [kaṇṭhá-, máṇi-¹]
2684 káṇḍati² 'is glad' Dhātup. [Cf. kaḍati 'is intoxicated' Dhātup.: ← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 369: √kaṇḍ²]
2685 kaṇḍana n. 'separating chaff from grain in a mortar, chaff' Suśr. [√kaṇḍ¹]
2688 kaṇḍū f. 'itching, the itch' Suśr., °ḍūti- f. 'sexual desire in women', °ḍūyā- f. 'itching' Suśr. com. [← Drav. or Austro-as. see kacchūˊ-]
2690 kaṇḍūla 'having a desire to scratch, itchy' Uttarar. [kaṇḍū-]
2691 kataka m. 'the clearing nut Strychnos potatorum' Mn.
2697 katīmuṣa 'name of a place in Kashmir' Rājat.

2698 *kattara 'useless, old, rubbish'. 2. *kattavāra-. [Just poss. comparative of kad pejorative prefix Pāṇ.; but cf. *katta- 'dregs', kaccara-¹ 'dirty' with same formation in Pk. kaccavāra- as 2 above; and Sk. kātara-]
2704 kathā́ 'conversation, speech' ĀśvGr̥., 'story' MBh. [Subst. formed of kathā́ 'how, why?' RV. EWA i 149: √kath]
2705 kathānaka n. 'a little tale' Vet. [kathā́-, katháyati X vyākhyā́na-: √kath]
2708 kathyatē 'is called' Pañcat., kathya- 'to be spoken about' R. [√kath]
2710 kadambá m. 'the tree Nauclea cadamba' MBh., °baka-, °bada-, kalamba-, °baka- m. lex. [EWA i 144 groups kadambá-, kaḍambá-, kaḍambī- as ← Drav. Tam. kaṭampu, &c.: T. Burrow BSOAS xii 369]
2710a †kadara- m.n. 'corn or callosity on foot' Suśr.
2711 *kadarikā-, kadara- m. 'iron goad for guiding an elephant' lex.

2712 kadala m., °līˊ- f. 'the banana plant Musa sapientum', °la- n. 'its fruit' MBh. Suśr., °lā- f., °laka- m., °likā- f. lex. 2. *kaḍalī-. [← Austro-as. EWA i 150 with lit. In S. it collides with kētaka-]
2720 kanthā¹ f. 'wall, town' lex., -kántha- n. in cmpd. 'town' Pāṇ. [← Ir. EWA i 151 with lit. Coincides with kaṇṭhá- in meanings 'wall, border, bank']
2723 kanda m. 'bulbous root' MBh., n. 'garlic' lex. [Prob. with gaṇḍa-¹ ← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 369 and EWA i 152 with lit.]
2724 kandará n. 'cave, glen' R., m. lex., °rīˊ- f.
2727 kandúka m. 'ball of wood or pith to play with' MBh., n. 'cushion' Bhartr̥. [With gēnduka- q.v. ← Drav.]
2729 kandūraka m. 'a kind of fragrant substance' lex. [Cf. kunduru-]
2730 kandhara m. 'neck' Yājñ. [A. Master BSOAS xii 352 ← Drav. cf. Tel. kandamu 'neck'; but see kaṇṭhá-]
2733 kanyakubja n. 'name of a town' (= Κανογυζα), kān° MBh., kanyāk° lex. [kanya-, kubjá-]
2740 kaparda m. 'a small shell' lex., °daka- m., °dikā- f. 'cowrie' Hit. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370]
2742 kapardín 'having braided hair' RV., '*having or wearing or like or worth cowries'. [kaparda-]
2743 kapala n. 'part, half' ŚāṅkhŚr. [Cf. kapaṭī- f. 'measure equal to a double handful'; prob. to be separated from kavala-, but see EWA i 154-5 with lit.]

2744 kapā́la n. 'skull, cranium' AV., 'cup, jar, bowl' TS., 'beggar's bowl' Mn., kapālikā- f. 'sherd' Kauś. 2. *kapalla-. 3. *kabhalla- beside bhágāla- PārGr̥. 4. *kappāla-. [Although IE. (cf. OEng. hafola 'head') EWA i 155, the variant MIA. and NIA. forms suggest at least influence by Austro-as. ND 73 b 27]
2747 kapi² m. 'Emblica officinalis, a species of the tree Pongamia glabra, olibanum' lex., kapikā- f. 'Vitex negundo' lex.
2748 kapikacchū f. 'the plant Mucuna pruritus' VarBr̥S., °chu-, °churā- f. lex. [kapí-¹, kacchūˊ-]

2749 kapittha m. 'the tree Feronia elephantum', n. 'its fruit the wood-apple' MBh. [For ending cf. dadhittha- m. 'id.' Gobh.; aśvatthá-, kulattha-, and for variation in MIA. and NIA. tth ~ ṭṭh cf. aśvatthá- in Si.: prob. only in pop. etym. connexion with kapí-¹, see EWA i 155]

2750 kapilá 'brown, tawny, reddish' RV., kapilaka-, °iraka- 'reddish' Pāṇ., kabila- lex. [Cf. kapiśa- 'brown' MBh.: for relationship 'monkey ~ brown' cf. G. mākṛũ s.v. markaṭa-, N. lākhu s.v. lākṣā-: kapí-¹]
2751 kapiśīrṣa n. 'the upper coping of a wall' lex. [kapí-¹, śīrśá-]
2752 kapīta m. 'name of a tree', °aka- n. 'Berberis asiatica' Bhpr.
2753 kapṓta m. 'pigeon, dove' RV., °aka- m. 'small do.' MBh.
2755 kapōlá m. 'cheek' Yājñ. 2. *kappōla-. [Prob. ← Austro-as., poss. ← Drav. EWA i 158 with lit.]
2757 kaphōṇi m.f. 'elbow', kaphaṇi- m.f., kuphaṇī- f. lex. [Cf. kaphauḍá- m. '(prob.) elbow' AV., and kūrpara-: EWA i 255 with PMWS 44 ← Munda rather than ← Drav. with Burrow TPS 1945, 96]
2758 kabandha-, kav° m. 'headless trunk' R. [EWA i 158 same as kábandha-, káv° m. 'big barrel' RV., 'belly' Nir., but perh. with Austro-as. prefix conn. with group of baṇḍá- PMWS 100]
2759 *kabbu 'feeble, yielding'. [Cf. kambuka- m. 'mean person' lex., °bū- m. 'thief' W., poss., with semantic equivalence 'chaff ~ worthless', same as kábru- n., kambūˊka- m. 'husk of rice' AV.]

2760 kamaṭha m. 'bamboo' lex. 2. *kāmaṭha-. 3. *kāmāṭṭha-. 4. *kammaṭha-. 5. *kammaṭṭha-. 6. *kambāṭha-. 7. *kambiṭṭha-. [Cf. kambi- 'shoot of bamboo', kārmuka-² n. 'bow' Mn., 'bamboo' lex. which may therefore belong here rather than to kr̥múka-. Certainly ← Austro-as. PMWS 33 with lit
2761 kamaṇḍalu¹ m.n. 'gourd or other vessel used for water' MBh.
2764 kamala² n. 'lotus' R. [Like kavāra-, kavēla- n. lex., kuvalaya- n. MBh. and Pk. kalima- n. ← Drav. EWA i 160]
2771 kambalá¹ m.n. 'woollen blanket or upper garment' AV., °laka- m. 'a woollen cloth' Suśr., °likā- f. Pāṇ. [If ← Austro-as. (EWA i 161 with lit) perh. cf. also ámbara-, in Pa. once ambala-]
2774 kambi f. 'branch or shoot of bamboo' lex. [See kamaṭha-]
2775 kambu m. 'shell, conch, shell ring or bracelet' MBh., n. 'bracelet' lex., °uka- m. 'shell' lex. [Cf. śambu-]
2780 kara² m. 'tax, tribute' Mn. [kāra-⁷ m. 'tax' Pāṇ.: ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 88; EWA i 166]
2784 karaṅka m. 'skull, head' Kathās., 'any bone of the body' lex.
2785 kárañja m. 'the tree Pongamia glabra' RV. (?) Āp., °jaka- m., °jikā- f. MBh., karaja- m. lex.
2787 karaṭa¹ m. 'crow' BhP., °aka- m. lex. [Cf. karaṭu-, karkaṭu- m. 'Numidian crane', karēṭu-, °ēṭavya-, °ēḍuka- m. lex., karaṇḍa²- m. 'duck' lex: see kāraṇḍava-]
2791 karaṇīya 'to be done' MBh. [Cf. karaṇi- f. 'action' Bālar., Pk. karaṇi- f.: √kr̥¹]

2795 karapattra n. 'saw' Suśr., °aka- n. lex. 2. *karaparṇa-. [By pop. etym. from kará¹- and páttra- (and parṇá-) EWA i 164 who connects with krakaca-, krakara-, Pa. khara-, Pk. karakaya- 'saw' perh. ← Drav. T. Burrow TPS 1945, 96]
2796 karapāla m. 'sword', °aka- m., °ikā- f. lex., karavāla-, °aka-, karabāla- m. [At least by pop. etym. from kará-¹, pālá- cf. *bhujapāla EWA i 165]
2797 karabhá m. 'camel' MBh., 'young camel' Pañcat., 'young elephant' BhP. 2. kalabhá- 'young elephant or camel' Pañcat. [Poss. a non-aryan kar- 'elephant' also in karḗṇu-, karin- EWA i 165]
2799 karamarda m. 'the tree Carissa carandas' MBh., °aka- m. 'the tree', n. 'its fruit' Suśr., °mardī- f. lex. 2. *karamārja-. [Cf. kāsamarda- ~ *kāsamārja-]

2800 karavīra m. 'oleander, Nerium odorum' MBh. 2. karṇikāra- m. 'Pterospermum acerifolium' MBh., kaṇēra- m. lex. 3. karṇāṭī- f. 'a kind of mimosa'. [Three forms of a word for 'oleander' all prob., like karavīra- (T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370) ← Drav., cf. esp. Tam. kaṇaviram, Kan. kaṇagil, Tel. gannēru. See karīˊra-²]
2805 karīˊra² (Uṇ. ká°) m. 'Capparis aphylla (a thorny plant eaten by camels)' ŚBr., n. 'its fruit' Suśr. 2. karibha- m. 'Ficus religiosa (?)' lex. [Same as karīra-¹?]

2806 kárīṣa¹ m.n. 'dung, dried cowdung, rubbish' ŚBr. [Bec. of ākhukarīṣá- 'mole-hill' EWA i 167 connects with kiráti rather than IE. *qers 'dirty' of WP i 428, but NIA. forms mean 'cowdung': for suffix cf. esp. púrīṣa-
2807 *karīṣa² 'a measure of land'. [Same as kárīṣa-¹, lit. 'the amount of manure required'?]

2812 karḗṇu m. 'elephant' MBh., °ṇu- or °ṇū- f. MBh., °ṇukā- f. Pañcat. [Feminine is earlier if, with J. Charpentier IL ii 67, < *kaṇēru- (after kariṇī-) < pejorative ka- and *ṇēru- 'tusk' in Pa. rēruka- 'ivory', i.e. 'having no or poor tusks'. But rather with EAW i 168 connected with kar- in karabhá-.]

2813 karōṭi f. 'cup, skull' Rājat., °ṭa- m. lex. 2. *karōṭṭi- [Prob. ← Drav. Mal. kuraṭṭa, Tu. koraṇṭu 'nut', Kan. karaṭa 'coconut shell', Tam. ciraṭṭai 'coconut shell, begging bowl' T. Burrow TPS 1945, 88]
2815 karká 'white' AV., m. 'white horse' MBh., 'a partic. gem' lex.

2816 karkaṭa¹ 'crab', °ṭaka- m. Suśr., °ṭī- f. MBh. [karka-² m. 'crab' lex.: comparison with gāṅgaṭa-, ciṅgaṭa-, *jhiṅga- suggests non-Aryan origin (cf. Sant. kaṭko̱m 'crab') and reinforces doubt expressed in EWA i 169 of generally accepted connexion with Lat. cancer, &c.]

2817 karkaṭa² m. 'name of various plants, curved root of a plant' lex., °ṭī- f. 'Cucumis utilissimus', °ṭaka- m. 'a kind of plant', n. 'a poisonous plant', °ṭikā- f. 'a kind of plant' Suśr. [Poss. same as karkaṭa-¹, but cf. karkāru-]
2818 karkaṭaśr̥ṅgī-, °gikā- f. 'gallnut (formed by an excrescence on Rhus succedana)' Suśr. [karkaṭa-¹, śŕ̥ṅga-]
2819 karkara¹ 'hard, firm' Mālatīm. [Prob. same as karkara-²; cf. karkaśá-, kakkhaṭa-, *kakkaṭa-², khára-²]
2820 karkara² m.n. 'stone', m. 'bone' lex. [Prob. same as karkara-¹: for semant. development 'ice ~ hail ~ stone' cf. aśáni-, úpala-]
2822 karkaśá 'rough, hard' MBh., °śā- f. 'name of a thorny shrub'. 2. *khakkhaśa-. [Cf. karkara-¹, kakkhaṭa-]
2823 karkāru-, °uka- m. 'the gourd Beninkasa cerifera' Suśr., °ru- n. 'its fruit' lex. [Cf. karkaṭa-²]

2825 karkōṭa n. 'a partic. fruit' Suśr., °aká- m. 'Momordica mixta', n. 'its fruit' Suśr., 'Aegle marmelos' lex., °akī- f. 'a plant with yellow flowers' Car., °ṭikā- f. 'Momordica mixta'. [See kakkōla-]
2826 *karkṣī 'accursed she-bear'. [For pejorative kā- with animals cf. Shughni xūrn 'crow' < *ku-warana- and Lith. kóvarnis 'raven' beside várna 'crow': kā- or ka-³, r̥kṣī-]
2827 karcarī f. 'a medicinal substance' Bhpr., °rikā- f. 'a kind of pastry or cake'. [Cf. karcūṭikā- f. 'a kind of pastry' lex.]

2828 karcūra '*yellow', m. 'turmeric' lex., n. 'an orpiment' Śiś., 'gold' lex., °aka- m. 'turmeric' lex. [Cf. karpūraka- and karbūra- m. 'Curcuma amhaldi or zerumbet, yellow orpiment', n. 'gold' lex.; karbura-]
2830 kárṇa m. 'ear, handle of a vessel' RV., 'end, tip (?)' RV. ii 34, 3. [Cf. *kāra- ⁶]
2831 kárṇaka m. 'projection on the side of a vessel, handle' ŚBr. [kárṇa-]
2832 karṇakaṇḍū f. 'painful itching of the ear' Suśr. [kárṇa-, kaṇḍū-]
2837 karṇapattraka m. 'lobe of the ear' Yājñ. [kárṇa-, páttra-]
2840 *karṇamarda 'touching the ears as a sign of disgrace or repentance'. [Semant. cf. H. kān pakaṛnā: kárṇa-, marda-]
2841 karṇamūla n. 'root of the ear' Suśr. [kárṇa-, mūˊla-]
2843 karṇavēdha m. 'ceremony of piercing the ears' lex. [kárṇa-, vēdha-]

2848 karṇāṭa-, °aka- m. 'name of a people' MBh., kārṇāṭa-bhāṣā- 'the Kanarese language' MW. [NIA. forms < kārṇāṭa- which supports interpretation as 'black country' (EWA i 172) and connexion with kāla-¹]
2849 kárṇikā f. 'round protuberance' Suśr., 'pericarp of a lotus' MBh., 'ear-ring' Kathās. [kárṇa-]
2851 kartá¹ m. 'hole' RV. [Cf. kāṭá- m. 'hole' RV., gárta-, *gaḍḍa-¹, *gaḍḍ-¹-, gaḍa-¹, *gallī-, *gālī-, *galī-, *khaḍḍa-, *khāḍa-, khalla-², *khāla-, *khala-³
2854 kártati¹ 'cuts' Ep. [Later pres. formation from aor. subj., fut., &c. replacing kr̥ntáti¹: with wide extension of MIA. kaṭṭ- to distinguish from katt- 'spin' < *kartati²: √kr̥t¹]
2858 kartari f. 'scissors, knife' Suśr., °rī- f. lex., °rikā- f. Hit. [< karttrī-

2867 karda m. 'mud, swamp' lex. [See kardaṭa-, kardáma-, *gadda-¹ (also Pk. gatta-, geḍḍa-), *gāḍa-²: this interchange suggests a non-Aryan origin independent of, or at most influencing, an IE. origin (Pers. čardeh 'blackish', &c. EWA i 173, Pokorny IEW 573). Connexion with kartá-¹ and *gaḍḍa- cannot be ruled out.]
2869 kardáma-, ká° m. 'mud, mire' KātyŚrS., kardamá- 'muddy' Pāṇ. [See list s.v. karda-]
2871 karpaṭa n. 'patched garment, rag' Pañcat. [← Austro-as. prefixed form of paṭa- of which -pāsa- in karpā́sa- is dial. form J. Przyluski BSL xxv 70, EWA i 174]
2874 *karpaṭamr̥ttikā 'wrapping in cloth and clay'. [karpaṭa-, mŕ̥ttikā-: cf. mod. cmpds. H. kapaṛmiṭṭī, M. kapaḍlep]
2877 karpā́sa m. 'the cotton plant Gosypium herbaceum' Suśr., n. 'cotton', °sī- f. 'the plant'. lex, °sakī- f. Bhpr. [← Austro-as. and perh. related to karpaṭa- EAW i 174 with lit.]
2880 karpūˊra m.n. 'camphor' Suśr. [Prob. ← Austro-as. EWA i 75 with lit.]
2881 karpūraka m. 'Curcuma zerumbet'. [From karbūra- or karcūra- after karpūˊra-, cf. P. kapūrī 'yellow' above]
2882 karbará 'spotted, variegated' lex. [Cf. karburá-, kambara-, *karbiśa-, śabála- which with karbu-, śabara-, śárvara- are from an Austro-as. word-group with various prefixes EWA i 175]
2883 *karbarāṅga 'having a spotted body'. [Cf. karburāṅga- m. 'a species of fly or bee' lex.: karbará-, áṅga-]
2887 karmakara m. 'workman, hired labourer' MBh. [Cf. karmakāra- from which it cannot in all cases be distinguished: kárman-¹, kará-¹]
2888 karmakāra 'doing work without wages' Kāś. on Pāṇ., °aka- m. 'one who does any work'. 2. karmakārin- 'doing any work'. [Cf. karmakara-
2889 karmakārāpayati 'causes to work as a servant' SaddhP. [karmakāra-]
2890 *karmakāṣṭhikā 'using a stick to make work'. [kárman-¹, kāṣṭhá-]
2891 karmakŕ̥t 'performing work, skilful in work' AV., 'one who has done any work' Pāṇ., m. 'workman' Rājat. [kárman-¹, kr̥t-]
2895 karmaraṅga m. 'Averrhoa carambola' R. [Cf. karmara-, °aka-, karmāra-, °aka- m. 'the plant' lex., karmaphala- n. 'its fruit' lex.]
2898 karmā́ra m. 'blacksmith' RV. [EWA i 176 < stem *karmar- ~ karman-, but perh. with ODBL 668 ← Drav. cf. Tam. karumā 'smith, smelter' whence meaning 'smith' was transferred also to karmakāra-]
2902 karmīˊṇa 'competent' in anuṣṭúp-karmīˊṇa- 'being performed with an a° verse' ŚBr., alaṁ-k° 'competent for any work' Pāṇ. [kárman-¹]
2903 *karyatē 'is done'. [Formed after act. karṓti and pass. caus. kāryatē: √kr̥¹]
2907 karṣaṇa n. 'tugging, ploughing, hurting' Mn., 'cultivated land' MBh. [kárṣati, √kr̥ṣ]
2914 kálatē 'sounds' Dhātup., kalayati³ 'makes a murmurous sound', kalakala- m. 'indistinct sound' Śiś. [kal³]
2915 kálatra n. 'pudendum muliebre' lex., 'wife' MBh., 'family' BHSk., káḍatra- Uṇ. BHSk.

2927 kalā́² f. 'any practical art' R. [← Drav. see kaláyati¹: √kal¹]

2931 kalāpa m. 'bundle, quiver of arrows' MBh., 'rope round an elephant's neck' lex., °aka- m. MBh. 2. kalamba-³ n. 'crowd' lex. [Cf. *kaḍappa- which supports deriv. from Drav. (Kan. kalappu 'miscellaneous collection' &c. T.Burrow BSOAS xii 371)]
2933 káli¹ m. 'the losing die with one dot' AV., 'the iron age' AitBr., 'strife, quarrel' MBh.

2941 kálpa 'capable' ŚBr., m. 'rule, practice' RV., 'an age' MBh. 2. *karpa-. [√kI̊p]
2943 kalpana n. 'cutting' VarBr̥S., °nā- f. 'arranging' Mn., 'making' Suśr., °nī- f. 'scissors' lex., karpaṇa- n. 'weapon' Daś. [√kI̊p]
2944 kalpáyati 'sets in order' RV., 'trims, cuts' VarBr̥S. [Cf. kr̥pāṇa- m. 'knife' Pāṇ.: √kI̊p]
2946 kalmaṣa n. 'stain, dregs, sin' Mn., karmaṣa- Kāś. [Cf. kalmā́ṣa- and kaśmalá- 'dirty' lex., m.n. 'despair' MBh.]
2947 kalmā́ṣa 'variegated, spotted' VS., n. 'stain' ŚBr., m. 'variegated colour' lex. [Cf. kalmaṣa-]
2949 kalya² 'deaf and dumb', kalla- 'deaf' lex., 'stammering' BHS 174. [kaḍá- 'dumb' ŚBr., kala- 'indistinct, dumb' ChUp.: √kal³]
2950 kalya⁴ n., °yā- f. 'spirituous liquor' lex. [Cf. kaḍaṅga- m. 'id.', kalukkā- f. 'tavern': ← Drav. see kaṇḍati²]
2951 kalyapāla-, °yāp° m. 'distiller of spirituous liquor' Rājat. [Some NIA. forms < *kallāla- from which kalyapāla- is an IA. creation: kalya-⁴, pālá-]
2953 kalyāṇī f. 'name of a river in Ceylon' MW. [kalyā́ṇa-]

2957 kávaca m.n. 'coat of mail' ŚBr., 'jacket' Kāṭh. [kavása- m. 'id.', kaváṣa- m. 'shield' lex.: ← Drav. EWA i 186 with lit.]

2960 kavala m. 'mouthful' MBh., 'gargle' Suśr., kavaḍa- m. Suśr., kabaḍa-, kapaḍa- Lüders PhilInd 559. [NIA. forms except Paś. can all derive from *kab/pala-: like kavaka- prob. ← Drav. e.g. Tam. kavaḷam, °ar̤am 'morsel of food', kavvu 'to bite' T. Burrow TPS 1945, 91]

2964 kaví 'wise' RV., m. 'wise man, poet' RV., °ika- m. lex.
2965 káśā f. 'whip' RV., 'rein' Śiś., 'string' lex., kaśa- m. 'whip, thong' MBh.

2967 káścid 'some one, anyone' RV., m.pl. kḗcid, n. kíṁcid q.v. Partially collides with kṓ'pi. [ká-²]
2969 kaśyápa² m. nom. prop. RV., 'class of divine beings associated with Prajāpati; of semi-divine genii regulating the course of the sun' AV., 'name of a mythical r̥ṣi' VS.
2972 kaṣati 'scratches' ChUp., 'rubs on a touchstone' Pāṇ. com., káṣ° 'hurts' Dhātup. [See khasa-¹: √kaṣ]

2974 kaṣāya 'yellowish red, astringent' Yājñ., n. 'an astringent juice' ŚBr. 2. *kaṣāva-. 3. *kaṣāra-. [Cf. Pa. kasaṭa- 'bitter, bad'. Variety of suffix (though -va- may be the colour suffix seen in śyāvá-) points to nonAryan origin]
2977 kaṣāyin 'yielding a resinous exhudation, astringent, dyed red' W. [kaṣāya-]

2987 kā́ṁsya 'made of bell-metal' KātyŚr., n. 'bell-metal' Yājñ., 'cup of bell-metal' MBh., °aka- n. 'bell-metal'. 2. *kāṁsiya-. [kaṁsá-¹]

2994 kākaciñcā-, °ñcī- f. 'Abrus precatorius'. [Many various forms: see EWA i 192]

2999 kāgni m. 'a small fire' Vop. [ka-³ or kā-, agní-]
3001 *kāṅkunikā f. 'a woman who lives on panic seed'. [*kaṅkunī-]

3009 kāca³ m. 'loop, string fastened to both ends of a pole, carrying yoke' lex. [← Drav. Kui kāsa, Kuvi kāñju, Kan. kāgaḍi, kāvaḍi T. Burrow BSOAS xii 372, EWA i 195. See kamaṭha-]

3023 kā́ṇḍa (kāṇḍá- TS.) m.n. 'single joint of a plant' AV., 'arrow' MBh., 'cluster, heap' (in tr̥ṇa-kāṇḍa- Pāṇ. Kāś.). [Poss. connexion with gaṇḍa-² makes prob. non-Aryan origin (not with P. Tedesco Language 22, 190 < kr̥ntáti). Prob. ← Drav., cf. Tam. kaṇ 'joint of bamboo or sugarcane' EWA i 197]
3027 kātara 'confused, discouraged, cowardly' Mn. 2. *kāthala-. [Der. from katará- EWA i 197; but cf. kattara-, i.e. it may belong to a group of words meaning 'weak, &c.']

3032 kāntāraka m. 'a kind of sugarcane', °ra- m. Suśr.
3037 kāpaṭa 'fraudulent' VarBr̥S. [Forms of G. < *kāpa- with -ṭa-, -la-, -ta- (or -ka-), -tra-. Cf. Sk. Pa. kapaṭa- m.n. 'fraud', Pk. kavaḍa- n.: prob. ← Drav. cf. kūṭá-¹ T. Burrow BSOAS xii 370]
3040 kā́pittha 'relating to the wood-apple tree Feronia elephantum' Pāṇ. [kapittha-]

3046 kāmpīla¹ m. 'name of a plant' Kauś., °pilya-, °pilla- m. lex., kampīla- n. 'pigment from Rottleria tinctoria' lex., kampilya- m. lex., °aka-, °pilvaka- m. Car., °pilla-, °aka- m. Suśr.
3047 kāmpīla² n. 'name of a town' VS., kāmpilya- n., °yā- f. 'a city of the Pañcālas' MBh., °pilla- m. 'a country in the NW of India' lex.
3048 kā́mya 'desirable' RV., °yā- f. 'name of an Apsaras' MBh. 2. *kāmiya-, cf. kāmika- 'desired' MBh. (sanskritized from kāmia- ?). [√kam]
3050 kāya² m. 'dwelling' lex. [kāyamāna- n. 'hut of straw' lex.
3051 kāyastha m. 'writer, man of the writer caste' Yājñ. [EWA i 200: kā́ya-¹, stha-]
3059 kāraṇḍava m. 'a kind of duck' MBh. [Cf. kāraṇḍa- m. 'id.' R., karēṭu- m. 'Numidian crane' lex.: see karaṭa-¹]

3061 kāravēlla m. 'the gourd Momordica charantia' Suśr., n. 'its fruit' lex., °lī- f. 'the plant', °laka- m., °likā- f. Suśr., kāravallī- f. Car. 2. *kārēlla-. [S. K. Chatterji's theory, Miscellany 74, of Drav. cmpd. 'black-spear' is supported by another name for this plant kāṇḍīra-]

3076 kārmika 'engaged in action, name of a partic. Buddhist sect', n. 'any variegated texture' Yājñ. [kárman-¹]

3080 kārṣāpaṇá m.n. 'a partic. coin or weight equivalent to one karṣa'. [karṣa- m. 'a partic. weight' Suśr. (cf. OPers. karša-) and paṇa-² or āpana- EWA i 176 and 202 with lit. But from early MIA. kā̆hā°]
3081 kā́rṣāpaṇika 'worth or bought for a kārṣāpaṇa' Pāṇ. [kārṣāpaṇá-]
3081a †*kārṣū- f. 'furrow, trench' ~ karṣūˊ- with dial. IA. a for ā < IE. o as in Av. karšū 'ploughed land' and in karṣí- ~ kā́rṣi- T. Burrow BSOAS xxxviii 70, Turner BSOAS xxxvi 429.
3082 kārṣmaryà m. 'the tree Gmelina arborea' TS., kārśmarī- f. lex., kāśmarya- m., °marī- f. MBh., °mīrī-, kambhārī-, gambhārī, °rikā- f. lex. [← Drav. T. Burrow BSOAS xii 372, EWA i 202]

3083 kāla¹ 'black, dark-blue' MBh., kā́laka- Pāṇ. (kā́lakā- f. 'a kind of bird' VS.), Central Asian Sk. kāḷa- H. Lüders PhilInd 553. [< *kāḍa- ← Drav. and poss. connected with kajjala-, karṇāṭa- EWA i 203 with lit.]

3104 kālya 'timely, seasonable' (prajanē kālyā- f. 'cow fit for the bull', see kālika-) Pāṇ., °yam, °yē 'at dawn' R. 2. kalya-³ n. 'dawn' lex., °yam 'at dawn, tomorrow' MBh., °yē BhP. [ka- < kā- with early shortening in adverb of time (similar subsequent shortenings in NIA. words below): kālá-²]
